instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3462 no backlight
threads.message:
Do you get image for sure?
Else, no reason to search for backlight.

Check at least if voltage appears at pins 28-30 iof J9000.
Did you try known good (compatible) LCD assembly?

BTW, no need to post boardview screenshot, once you post component voltages.

threads.title: 820-3462 no backlight

threads.title: 820-3462 no backlight
threads.message:
"5v but only in few seconds at the start"
LCD_HPD must go high at same time.
If not, PCH cannot detect the screen.

"there is apple logo"
You can't get image without the mentioned voltage!

lcd_hpd is 2,77V on r9000 -leg 1 leg 2 - 0v
on l 9000 there is 4,99 V
LCD_BKLT_EN 3,34v
LVDS_BKL_PWM_R - 3,21v
BKLT_EN - 3,12v

threads.title: 820-3462 no backlight
threads.message:
Check the traces between U/Q/D9701 and L9710.
Also check R9708/09, R9717-22 and their traces.
Be sure D9701 is not shorted.

threads.title: 820-3462 no backlight
threads.message: all look ok

threads.title: 820-3462 no backlight
threads.message: Looked, or checked with multimeter???

threads.title: 820-3462 no backlight
threads.message: multimeter

threads.title: 820-3462 no backlight
threads.message:
"lcd_hpd is 2,77V on r9000 -leg 1 leg 2 - 0v"
How is that possible, with 0 ohm resistor?

LCD_HPD is present for sure, if you get image.
But viewing erroneous measurment, this make me doubt about other values.
You've also posted two values for LCD_BKLT_EN.
Need accurate information to help.

"Be sure D9701 is not shorted."
I mean between its pins; A-K, not any pin to ground!

What is actual voltage at C9000?
Remember to keep LCD connected, when you measure image/backlight signals.
